title.narrative: Upgrading TVET Colleges based on the PPDP mode

description.narrative:
UNIDO is developing an integrated vocational training system to address the key constraints of TVET system in Ethiopia, with particular focus on automotive assembly, construction machinery assembly, wind generator assembly and installation. This pilot project will improve the policy dialogue, the TVET workshop infrastructure and training curriculum of the TVET system. The project will support the creation pilot automotive, construction machinery and wind generator assembly training center in TVET Colleges jointly selected by the government of Ethiopia and cooperating private sector. UNIDO mobilized private partner companies such as Futon Automotive, Lifan Group and SANY group for the design and implementation of the project.
The government of Ethiopia requested UNIDO to develop a project to unlock key constraints that hinder the development of the TVET sector in the country. A cooperation agreement was signed between UNIDO, the Hunan province of China and the Federal TVET agency of Ethiopia to improve TVET system in selected region of Ethiopia. Subsequently, the UNIDO developed concept note was highly appreciated by Hunan province of China. At the same time UNIDO approached the Permanent Mission China, Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM), and other partner institutes for possible financing and partnership in this project and affirmative response was received to finance cooperation project with Sendafa-Bake TVET College from China’s voluntary contribution and Adama TVET from SSCAF. The permanent mission of China and the Lifan Group also visited Sendafa-Bake TVET College and discussed with the College administration about the proposed project.
The project will also increase the participation of private companies by strengthening the application of Public Private Development Partnership (PPDP) model in the TVET sector. By choosing the PPDP modality, the project aims to strengthen the linkage between manufacturing sector and TVET schools. By introducing new training programs, the project will improve the supply of skilled personnel to the growing manufacturing sector.
It will support the Growth and Transformation Plan (GTP II) of Ethiopia by supplying competent technicians. Furthermore, the project is expected to play a great role in the economic and social development of the country by producing mid-level skilled human power and well skilled professionals, who could take part in the automotive, construction machinery and wind power generator industries.
The project will form a key part of the Programme for Country Partnership for Ethiopia (PCP Ethiopia).The PCP Ethiopia brings together development partners, UN agencies, development finance institutions and the private sector – under the ownership of the Ethiopian Government.
The project will be implemented in close cooperation with UNIDO, the Federal TVET Agency of Ethiopia, Futon Automotive, Lifan Group, SANY group, and will bring together all stakeholders to address the constraints. Project sites and two existing TVET Collages (Sendafa-Bake and Adama TVET) were selected and agreed with counterparts to host the training center.
